issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.iqiyi.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iqiyi.com%2F) ### Comment > 在https://www.iqiyi.com/封面右键元素里找到播放链接，如果AdGuard开启下面2项功就算把问题域名设为白名单世 > 不能解决问题 > 1,【"AdGuard URL跟踪过滤器 > 通过从URL中删除跟踪参数来增强隐私的过滤器。” > 2."Legitimate URL Shortener > 自动从URL中删除不必要的"$'和'&'值，使它们更容易从URL栏中复制并作为链接 > 粘贴到其他地方。已包含在Dandelion Sprout的防骚扰列表中。】" > 会导致爱奇艺视频网站不能正常打开。关闭AdGuārd打开元素里面复制的链接就正 > 常打开 > 这是我最喜欢的2个功希望能修复规则，同时网站也是最知名的视频网站 > > > > Find the playback link in the element.If AdGuard enables the > following two functions,even if the problem domain is > whitelisted,it cannot solve the problem > 1.AdGuard URL Tracking Filter > A privacy enhancing filter that removes tracking parameters > from URLs > 2.Legal URL Shorter > Automatically remove unnecessary '$and'&'values from > URLs,making them easier to copy from the URL bar and > paste as links elsewhere.Already included in Dandelion > Sprout's anti harassment list > It will cause the iQiyi video website to not open properly. > Close AdGuard and open the copied link in the element to > open it normally > These are my favorite 2 features that I hope can fix the rules. > and the website is also the most well-known video website ### Screenshots

I've encountered some issues while using AdGuard and hope they can be improved. I'm using Android 15.0 on my phone, and the following apps have ads that AdGuard fails to block effectively: 1. iQIYI (Version 16.4.7): There are long pre - roll ads before video playback, mid - roll ads during playback, and ads on some film and TV recommendation pages. 2. Douyin (Version 34.3.0): Advertisement videos are interspersed in the video feed, and ad recommendations sometimes appear on the search results page. 3. X (Version 10.96.0 - release.0): Advertisement tweets show up in the home feed, and there are ad spaces on the sidebar. 4. Uptodown App Store (Version 6.66): There are ads on the app recommendation page. 5. Kuaishou (Version 13.4.10.41735): Ads are displayed on the video recommendation page and personal homepage, and ads may also pop up during live broadcasts. 6. QQ Browser (Version 16.3.0.0033): There are ads on the new tab page and search results page, and some ads cannot be blocked while browsing web pages. 7. TikTok (Version 39.8.4): Similar to Douyin, there are ads on the video feed and search results pages. 8. Tencent Video (Version 9.01.20.29991): There are ads before, during, and after video playback, and there are also a small number of promotional ads in VIP - exclusive content. 9. Youku Video (Version 11.1.38): Ads are frequent before and during video playback, and there are also ads on the drama details page. 10. Browser (Version 40.9.10.1_bdc29ce_250509): Some web ads cannot be blocked while browsing. 11. Weibo (Version 15.5.0): Ads are interspersed in the home feed, and there are also ads on topic pages and search results pages. 12. Facebook (Version 512.0.0.64.75): Promotional posts often appear in the news feed, and there are ad spaces on the sidebar. 13. Instagram (Version 379.1.0.43.80): Sponsored content ads appear in the user feed, and ad recommendations may also be on the explore page. 14. Threads (Version 380.0.0.45.88): Currently, ads have started to appear in the content feed, affecting the user experience. 15. YouTube (Version 20.18.34): There are many pre - roll ads, mid - roll ads during video playback, and ads on the video recommendation page. 16. QQ Mail (Version 7.0.3): There may be advertising emails in the mail list, and ads are also displayed on some function pages. 17. Gmail (Version 2025.04.27.755574423.Release): Ads appear on the sidebar of the mail list and other positions. 18. Google Play Store (Version 46.0.19 - 31 [0] [PR] 751509063): There are promotional ads on app recommendation and ranking pages. Hope the AdGuard team can optimize and improve the ad - blocking for these apps to enhance the user experience. Thank you very much! Report Date: May 13, 2025, 23:36 (Washington, D.C. time)

need example.

issue.title: Add global removal for  Substack "subscribe" landing page to Adguard Annoyance.

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_
